paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The initial manifestation of amyloidosis consisted of numbness in the limbs in Patients 1 (Val94Gly).

individual_records.phenotype_details: neuropathy, could not maintain a standing position due to weakness in the lower limbs
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Another patient (Patient 2) did not complain of any orthostatic symptoms because this patient could not maintain a standing position due to weakness in the lower limbs.
The initial manifestation of amyloidosis consisted of numbness in the limbs in Patients 3 (Pro24Ser).
The initial manifestation of vitreous opacities due to amyloidosis in Patient 5 (Tyr114Cys) appeared seven years before the autonomic tests.

functional_data.summary: The study assessed cardiac and peripheral vasomotor autonomic functions in patients with TTR mutations.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation and functional tests.
variants.additional_notes: All patients exhibited some symptoms attributable to autonomic dysfunction.
key_quotes: Cardiac and peripheral vasomotor autonomic dysfunctions were prevalent in non-Val30Met patients, irrespective of their phenotype.
All patients reported some symptoms that were attributable to autonomic dysfunctions at the time of the autonomic tests.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
